glosses: causative of silahlanmak (“to take up arms”): To arm, to make or let become armed.

etymology: Inherited from Ottoman Turkish سلاحلندرمق, or سلاحلندیرمق (silaḥlandırmaḳ, “to make or let arm”) from سلاح (silaḥ), equivalent to silah + -la + -n + -dır + -mak. Cognates with Azerbaijani silahlandırmaq.
